sense.name: fight authority
sense.examples: Our brains are going to revolt. They worried customers would revolt if they found out. My wobbly legs revolt, refusing to hold me up one more second. John revolted against Mary's tyrannical rule. It accused Catholic priests of inciting citizens to revolt. Aristagoras had no option but to incite his own people to revolt. Also coming up, the cast of South Park revolts. My staff would revolt if I brought in a Roma. Democrats could revolt against any budget deal the president may sign.

sense.name: Gross out, disgust
sense.examples: The sight, a body hidden in a bad, was revolting. Does it really not revolt you? Mary was revolted by John's pile of dirty dishes. The thought of having to screw Bodeau was making all sex revolting to him The thumbs in the glass were revolting yet they fascinated me. I revolt you?
